title: For Sale/Trade:   Harris Bipod 9-13" LM-S and LT706 QD Swivel Mount Combo
postcontent:
Easy tension adjustability, with a higher bipod for seeing over rough terrain.
This LT706 combo combines the excellent Harris LM-S 9"-13" bipod with an integral, low-profile LaRue QD lever mount. They replaced the Harris OEM stud attachment base with a custom chassis... ruling-out the risk of the stud screw and grabber becoming loose. By doing so, they were able to lower the profile by roughly .25". A large knob on the rear provides easy leverage when adjusting swivel tension, especially when in the prone position. The bipod has 9-13" Legs (with leg notches). The notched legs provide a more positive lockup, keeping legs from collapsing unintentionally.

Our adjustable base attaches to any MIL-1913 picatinny rail. Complete with necessary hardware, tools and Instructions.

location: 45 min west of Kalamazoo, Kalamazoo, Michigan
postcontent:
Breaking my rule to never sell gun stuff...but I want to build ARs for 2 of my kids for their upcoming birthdays and I need to fund the build. 

This is an ATI polymer lower that I bought during the height of the "scare".  It is stripped and has never been assembled.
+ ATI polymer lower for AR15
+ 4473 listed it as a rifle so it must be used for that...no pistol builds
+ I've built up a very lightweight .22 AR15 with this lower's brother...everything fit and functioned...the rifle ended up weighing just shy of 5.5 lbs even with an optic
+ Very little stress is run through the lower receiver on an AR...so don't be worried that this won't handle the recoil of a 5.56

I bought these when they were "cheap" at $69 (when aluminum lowers were running >$150).  Since regular lowers are selling as cheap as $50 now, I'll sell this lower for $39 + actual shipping + insurance (if desired). I will only ship to FFL or meet face to face if you are in the area.

Thanks for looking!!

title: For Sale:  Kansas Concealed Carry Class in Hutchinson
postcontent:
Dark Horse Protection and Investigation will be holding a Kansas Concealed Carry License Class on January 24th, 2015 in Hutchinson. 

This class is mandatory with guidelines set forth by the Attorney General for the State of Kansas for most individuals seeking to obtain a Kansas Concealed Carry License. The class is an 8 hour class which includes time on the range for qualification. You must have 18 out of 25 rounds in the scoring portion of the target and the greatest distance you fire from is 30 feet. Class will beging at 8am and go until 5pm with an hour for lunch.

Start the new year off right by obtaining your CCL just the way you've meant to do since the laws changed. Now is the time to begin learning how to protect yourself and the ones you hold dear.

Refuse to be a victim! Carrying concealed gives you a significant tactical advantege. 

Call Leo at REDACTED and reserve your seat now. Prepayment guarentees your seat. Seating for this class is 20 people, and we don't expect them to last long. The cost of the class is $75.00

title: For Sale:  Colt M4 LE6920 - NEVER BEEN SHOT!!
postcontent:
*If this listing is still active then it's still available.

I wasn't in a real hurry to sell this that bad, but since I'm most likely moving back to California in a few months I'm putting up for sale my Colt M4. I really hope I don't need to stress you on the quality of a Colt vs any other lesser brand, so I'll just focus on the rifle itself and leave it at that.

I bought this last Feb as my "welcome to Washington" gift to myself meant to be my build up project, but since then it has been sitting in storage. It was bought brand new and like I said my rifle has NEVER BEEN SHOT (other than factory testing I suppose). You can inspect it yourself, the innards are clean as a whistle and still factory oiled. As the pictures will show I added a sling mount on the buffer tube to hang it on a 1 point sling, as well as a UTG pistol grip with compartment slot under it, and I bought a steel USGI (not aluminum) magazine for it to replace the goofy looking Magpul mag it came with. It also has a rear flip up sight and the stock is a locking Rogers Super Stoc, not the loosy goosy kind that come standard with most AR-15's. Being that it's a Colt the hand guard has a dual heat shield under it. Seeing as how I wont have any use for the one point bungee sling in the pics, I guess I'll just throw that in. 

It's practically a brand new gun so I dont think I'm willing to barter with the price. If you'd like to buy an out of the box brand new Colt from a gun shop and pay the taxes and fees, be my guest, but why not save yourself a few hundred bucks? You'll basically be getting the same gun for face value plus the add ons I've already bought for it as bonuses. It's a good deal, first come first served.

title: For Sale:  Custom Stainless Springfield TRP
postcontent:
Up for sale is my stainless Springfield TRP I originally purchased. I wanted to put some quality parts in the gun and really make it mine. I love how it came out. 
Parts List:
Nighthawk - Cocobolo Grips, Extended bushing and matching plug, GI guide rod, Magazine release, #15 spring.
Wilson combat - Bulletproof sear and Disconnector, Bulletproof Spec-ops Hammer, Bulletproof side release, and Bulletproof single side safety.
Ed Brown - Mainspring housing and Magwell
Machine work - Barrel was cut down and re-crowned for a flush fit with bushing. Trigger is smooth 4.5-5lb. Polished feed ramps and internals.
Comes with 5 mags: 2 Original Springfield mags, 1 Chip McCormick Power 10, and 3, 8 round Tripp Research Cobramag HV. (best 1911 mags IMHO)

title: For Sale/Trade:  1938 German Mauser
postcontent:
For Sale / Trade

A 1938 German Mauser with the “27” factory code for “Erma”.

This mauser is 80% numbers matching SN 69xx-K the stock and bolt do not numbers match the rifle. BUT, both the stock and bolt have the Weimar Eagle acceptance stamp and are correct for the year of 1938. The bolt matches itself.

All proof marks are intact and have not been peened out. I filled them in with Brownell’s Lacquer  stick to make them visible.

The bore is clean, bright, sharp and NO rust or frosting.
this is NOT a R/C But is an early 80’s import as there are import stampings on both sides of the barrel about  2 inch’s back from the muzzle, look close.

This is a very good pre-war mauser for the collector who is looking for a pre-war rifle that is correct but will not break the bank.

More photo’s available.

Price - $875. – FIRM.

Thanks for looking.

title: For Sale:  12 Gauge Rossi Rifled single shot slug gun
postcontent: Looking to sell my 12 gauge Rossi single shot slug gun. I bought this for a deer hunt last year that never happened and it has been sitting in my safe ever since. It's a very nice shotgun, I just don't have any use for it. It's got a 23" heavy, ported barrel. Takes up to 3" slugs. The overall length is 38.5" so its pretty nice and compact. It comes with a sling and a scope mount, which can easily be removed if you wanted to. There are holes drilled and tapped for iron sights, but the previous owner removed them and couldn't find them when he sold me the gun. I'm sure the thread pitch is standard so you can install a bead sight, fiber optic, etc. The wood of the stock and forearm is also very good and only has some minor scuffs and dings. Rifling looks perfect. Nice thick recoil pad too. Any other questions, feel free to ask. Looking to get $100. Email me if interested.

title: For Sale:  .223 RELOADING CLASS
location: NE COLORADO SPRINGS, Colorado Springs, Colorado
postcontent:
LiveFire Armory is sponsoring an Introduction to Reloading Class.  

The class will specialize in the .223 and 5.56.

All supplies and materials are included.  

The 3-hour Class will cover safe reloading practices including:

Press Setup, 
Die Adjustment, 
Powder Selection for various Bullet Weights and Velocities,
Primer and Bullet Selection.

The Class will cover both single stage and progressive reloading.

Each student will reload 20 .223 cartridges for testing in your AR.

The Class is limited to 4 students.  

The Class schedule will begin in mid January with both weekend and evening schedules available. 

Please respond to this listing with your name and contact information to reserve a place.  As the dates and times are set, you will receive a choice of dates.
